name: AROBS Software
tag_list: custom-software-development, offshore-software-outsourcing, nearshore-software-outsourcing, it-consulting, mobile-application-development, java-application-development, asp-net-application-development, iphone-apps, android-apps, php-application-developmen
overview:
AROBS Transilvania Software is a Romanian provider of software outsourcing, custom software development services and IT solutions. The company have been developing web applications, client/server solutions (medical, economic), applications for automation and household appliances, data acquisition, monitoring and control, travel agency automation, mobile solutions for the Apple, Symbian, Blackberry, Windows Phone 7, and Android platforms, back-end systems for businesses, management information systems, e-Commerce applications, solutions for sales force automation (retail), e-Learning, GPS-based car fleet tracking.

Other services offered by AROBS include software maintenance and testing, legacy system integration/migration/porting. IT consultancy, technical support, product management and development, personnel rental. Companies from all over the world have chose us as trusted partners for software development.

AROBS’ initial focus on Java, Microsoft, Apple, and AS/400 technologies has expanded over time to include trendy technologies like iPhone, Android, Symbian, Silverlight, etc.

The company’s customer portfolio followed a similar trend, currently including over 800 Romanian clients and many prestigious foreign customers from the USA, Finland, Germany, Switzerland, Norway, Austria, and the Netherlands.

In march 2006, AROBS started to distribute GPS navigation solutions which include Mio, E-TEN, Qtek, MyGuideGPS, and NavRoad.

AROBS Transilvania Software is a well known IT companies in Romania, having as clients prestigious companies like RCS&RDS, Domo, Jidvei SA, Eximtur, Carrefour, Mobile Distribution â€“ Euro GSM, Intrebrew (Centrala de achiziÅ£ii).

The company has consolidated its financial position in the Romanian IT&C market by selling 10% of its shares to the Finnish Investment Fond, Berling Capital, which has important investments in the hospitality, travel, financial, and software industries.
